All snakes are small, so plenty of room. Of the safe moves (DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT—UP goes off board), DOWN moves me directly towards the closest apple at (1,4) while keeping options open: from (1,7), I can continue down, left to (0,7), or right to (2,7). LEFT to (0,8) angles toward (0,1) but splits options slightly. RIGHT to (2,8) opens wide space but doesn't target an apple yet. Enemy at (7,2) isn't close, so no immediate collision risk. Prioritizing progression to an apple safely, DOWN is best.

Long-term plan for next few turns: Continue heading directly south toward (1,4) to eat it, then pivot toward (0,1) or (4,0), avoiding enemy path at (7,2) and keeping to open spaces to maintain escape routes.

DOWN

All snakes remain small, providing ample space. Safe moves are UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT (none kill immediately: no off-board, no body collisions, no obvious head-ons). From (1,7), DOWN advances directly toward the nearby apple at (1,4) in 3 moves (keeping 3 follow-up options after: left, right, up). LEFT moves to (0,7), nearing an edge with 3 options (up, down, right). RIGHT to (2,7) opens center space with 4 options (up, down, left, right) but doesn't target an apple yet. UP to (1,8) retreats with 3 options (left, right, down) and avoids apples. Enemy at (7,3) is distant and unlikely to intersect soon. DOWN best prioritizes safe apple pursuit while maintaining escape routes.

Long-term plan for next few turns: Head south through (1,6) to (1,5) and eat (1,4) on turn 5, then decide: pivot left to (1,3) then left to x=0 for (0,1), or right to evade enemy if it heads left. Avoid tight spaces; watch enemy for 50-apple cap.

DOWN

Down advances directly toward the nearby apple at (1,4) in 2 moves total (DOWN this turn to (1,5), then DOWN next turn to (1,4) and eat it), prioritizing safe apple collection while keeping 3 follow-up options at (1,5) (left, right, up). Left moves to (0,6), edging closer to board boundary with 3 options (up, down, right), but off the direct path to apples. Right to (2,6) opens more center space with 4 options and a possible path toward (5,7) or (7,0), but delays apple pursuit. Up to (1,7) reverses last move unnecessarily with 3 options, avoiding nearby apples. No immediate threats: enemy at (7,2) is far, but their next move could head this way, so securing the close apple first is prudent. After eating at (1,4) around turn 4, pivot westward toward (0,1) if no enemy interference, or right to evade; keep watching for head-on or body risks.

DOWN

Safe moves: All four directions are within bounds, no obstacles, no enemy collision risk this turn.

Prioritize completing the planned path to eat the nearby apple at (1,4), aligning with strategies to collect safely while keeping options open post-growth. Enemy is distant at (7,1), no immediate head-on threats. After eating, body will extend to [(1,5)], opening more maneuvers; plan to then head toward (0,1) or (4,0) in future turns, watching for enemy approaches from the right.

DOWN

Safe moves from (1,4): UP into own body (1,5) — die, eliminated. DOWN to (1,3), LEFT to (0,4), RIGHT to (2,4) are all on empty cells, within bounds, and avoid enemy bodies (enemy head at (7,0) is distant).

Among these, LEFT to (0,4) or DOWN to (1,3) both close the Manhattan distance to nearby apple at (0,1) from 4 to 3, keeping a path open (e.g., LEFT then DOWNs southbound). RIGHT to (2,4) increases distance, so avoid. To maximize future options while progressing toward (0,1): LEFT skirts the left boundary without trapping me (can still reverse right or go up/down). No likely head-on collision risk yet (enemy at (7,0) only has safe LEFT/RIGHT options, not toward me).

Long-term plan: From (0,4), continue DOWN to (0,3), (0,2), (0,1) to eat, extending body and shifting tail to (1,5) for more flexibility. Post-eat, loop up toward (5,7) or (2,7) apples while monitoring enemy from x=7 (right side), avoiding tight paths.

LEFT

Safe moves: UP to (0,5) - empty cell, avoids body and board edges, no immediate collision risk (enemy head at (6,0) is far away and likely moving horizontally/right on the x=6-7 corridor). DOWN to (0,3) - empty cell, directly progresses toward nearest apple at (0,1) (Manhattan distance from current (0,4) drops from 3 to 2), stays on open aisle with plenty of vertical space below and potential horizontal escape later, no self-collision or enemy threat nearby. Other directions are lethal: LEFT off-board, RIGHT into own tail.

Among safe moves, prioritize DOWN for shorter path to a reachable apple ((0,1)) without closing options—post-eat, I can extend body upward or rightward toward (5,7) or (2,7) while the enemy (predictably avoiding its own body at (7,0) and apple at (4,0)) stays in the low-x area. UP keeps me high-y (less walled) but slightly increases apple distance and trends away from the cluster of three apples on the left-upper board. No head-on possibilities yet; enemy can't reach x=0 this turn. Longer plan: Eat (0,1) on turn 8-9, then snake left along y=1 to vacate the x=0 flute, loop north toward (2,7) or (5,7), monitor enemy for blockades near mid-board apples—avoid getting hemmed in the bottom-left corner if enemy expands right.

DOWN

Safe moves: DOWN to (0,2) - empty cell, avoids all collisions, edges, and backwards into body; progresses directly toward apple at (0,1) (now 1 cell away, reachable next turn assuming no interference). RIGHT to (1,3) - also empty, safe, opens horizontal maneuvering space but moves away from the close apple, staying in a more exposed position near the board edge with fewer immediate options.

Prioritize DOWN for the shortest path to a guaranteed apple payoff without sacrificing options—post-eat, I can shift left along y=1 to (2,1) or further right for space, then loop up toward the y=7 apples while monitoring enemy expansion from the bottom (they'll likely eat (4,0) next turn, growing and possibly claiming mid-board corridors). Keep snake elongating vertically first to control x=0 before pivoting, avoiding enemy head-ons and dead-ends.

DOWN

Long-term plan: After eating the apple at (0,1), with head at (0,1) and body growing, prioritize shortening the body along x=0 briefly if possible, but likely move RIGHT to (1,1) next to open up space and gain access to the middle board. Then head north toward the y=7 apples at (2,7) or (5,7), choosing paths that avoid enemy expansion from the bottom/x=4 area. Keep length manageable to retain maneuverability and watch for potential head-on risks with enemy snake.
